centre.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the middle of a space, area, or object, especially the exact middle
centre.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: lines radiating out from the centre
There was an enormous oak table in the center of the room.
The hotel is right in the centre of the village.
Draw a line through the centre of the circle.
centre.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a building which is used for a particular purpose or activity
centre.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: an exhibition at the Community Arts Centre
the European Centre for Nuclear Research
centre.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a place where there is a lot of a particular type of business, activity etc
centre.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: It’s not exactly a cultural center like Paris.
The city became a centre for the paper industry.
a center of academic excellence  (=a very good place for education)
centre.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the part of a town or city where most of the shops, restaurants, cinemas, theatres etc are
centre.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: the main route into Leeds city centre
centre.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a player in sports such as American football and basketball who plays in or near the middle of the field or playing area
centre.translation[0].definitions[4].not: centre forward/half/back etc (=players in different parts of the middle section of the playing area)
centre.translation[0].note_box[0].headin: – Meaning 2: a building which is used for a particular purpose or activity
centre.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: They are building a huge new shopping centre just outside the town.
For further details contact the Tourist Information Centre.
The forest has a visitor centre with information and refreshment facilities.
There's a leisure centre with a swimming pool, a sauna, and a gymnasium.
You could join exercise classes at your local sports centre.
The garden centre stocks a wide variety of houseplants.
Shall we go to the concert at the arts centre on Saturday?
The exhibition centre has an interesting display of contemporary art.
the new research centre at King's College Hospital
Westgate Hotel has sixty bedrooms and a conference centre.
He was a new recruit at the police training centre.
The village has a small school and a health centre.
A new day centre for the over 70s has recently opened.
The church has been converted into a community centre.
Many elderly people come to the education centre to learn to use computers.
I got the job through an advertisement at the job centre.
The money will be used to provide a youth centre.
centre.translation[0].note_box[1].headin: – Meaning 3: a place where there is a lot of a particular type of business, activity etc
centre.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: Boston is a leading financial centre.
The company has branches worldwide in fifteen major business centres.
Our city is the biggest commercial centre in the country.
Paris was then the cultural centre of Europe.
Our destination was Queenstown, a tourist centre set amid mountains and lakes.
The town was a trading centre for the Romans.
The region has been named as a major centre of international terrorism.
The Asian Pacific Rim is a major world centre of commerce, industry, and economic activity.
Zurich is an international centre of finance.
The gardens are a national centre for botanical research.
centre.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to move something to a position at the centre of something else
centre.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The title isn’t quite centred on the page, is it?
centre.translation[2].definitions[0].def: the place where most of the important things connected with a business or activity happen
centre.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Bahrain has become a major international banking centre.
plans to turn the town into a centre of high-tech inward investment
centre.translation[2].definitions[1].def: a building that is used for a particular activity
centre.translation[2].definitions[2].def: the part of a town or city where most of the shops, offices, restaurants, cinemas etc are
centre.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: Our head office is located in the centre of London
